name: github-workflow
description: A pulumi package generated from a json schema

github-workflow:index:read.description: Read the given JSON into the object model

github-workflow:index:write.description: Read the given JSON into the object model

name.description: The name of your workflow. GitHub displays the names of your workflows on your repository's actions page. If you omit this field, GitHub sets the name to the workflow's filename.

run-name.description: The name for workflow runs generated from the workflow. GitHub displays the workflow run name in the list of workflow runs on your repository's 'Actions' tab.

working-directory.description: Using the working-directory keyword, you can specify the working directory of where to run the command.

github-workflow:index:jobs.description:
A workflow run is made up of one or more jobs. Jobs run in parallel by default. To run jobs sequentially, you can define dependencies on other jobs using the jobs.<job_id>.needs keyword.
Each job runs in a fresh instance of the virtual environment specified by runs-on.
You can run an unlimited number of jobs as long as you are within the workflow usage limits. For more information, see https://help.github.com/en/github/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#usage-limits.
